alert.note: Alert for Knox; Peoria; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 7:36AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stark, northern Knox and northwestern Peoria Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 736 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oneida, or 11 miles northeast of Galesburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Altona around 740 AM CDT. Victoria around 750 AM CDT. La Fayette around 755 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wyoming, Toulon and West Jersey. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
